2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis has mixed feelings about watching the game. While they are happy when Jacob Walker is around, they are less enthusiastic when Jack Taylor is present. Alice Lewis seems to prefer watching the game at The Crooked Billet, but ended up at The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Alexander White. Overall, Alice Lewis had an okay time watching the game despite not being at their preferred location. The following day, Alice Lewis joined William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker for a relaxing day at Victoria Park. They are now deciding where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis can decide where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet with Jacob Walker and avoid Jack Taylor.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Alexander White: 0.8
          Jack Taylor: 0.2
          Jacob Walker: 0.2
          William Jones: 0.6
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          Question: What action Alice Lewis should do now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would follow the counterpart's suggestion because the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis has mixed feelings about watching the game. While they are happy when Jacob Walker is around, they are less enthusiastic when Jack Taylor is present. Alice Lewis seems to prefer watching the game at The Crooked Billet, but ended up at The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Alexander White. Overall, Alice Lewis had an okay time watching the game despite not being at their preferred location. The following day, Alice Lewis joined William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker for a relaxing day at Victoria Park. They are now deciding where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game.

        • Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Observation: Alice Lewis has mixed feelings about watching the game. While they are happy when Jacob Walker is around, they are less enthusiastic when Jack Taylor is present. Alice Lewis seems to prefer watching the game at The Crooked Billet, but ended up at The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Alexander White. Overall, Alice Lewis had an okay time watching the game despite not being at their preferred location. The following day, Alice Lewis joined William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker for a relaxing day at Victoria Park. They are now deciding where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis can decide where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
        FinalAction
      • Question: What action Alice Lewis should do now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: What action Alice Lewis should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alice Lewis would follow the counterpart's suggestion because the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet with Jacob Walker and avoid Jack Taylor.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Alexander White: 0.8
          Jack Taylor: 0.2
          Jacob Walker: 0.2
          William Jones: 0.6
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          Question: What action Alice Lewis should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Alice Lewis MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Alice Lewis can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Alice Lewis would follow the counterpart's suggestion because the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.

          Prompt

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest his favorite pub, The Princess of Wales, as the best place to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, sharing some drinks and conversation.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jacob Walker are already lounging with Jack Taylor. The group is trying to decide where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game tonight; Alice Lewis suggests The Crooked Billet, while William Jones and Jacob Walker prefer The Princess of Wales.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest The Crooked Billet to the group or he could agree to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to the group.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Jack Taylor: 0.2
          Alice Lewis: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.7
          Jacob Walker: 0.3
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White would suggest The Crooked Billet to the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.

The group is trying to decide where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game tonight; Alice Lewis suggests The Crooked Billet, while William Jones and Jacob Walker prefer The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest The Crooked Billet to the group or he could agree to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to the group.

          Question: What action Alexander White should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Alexander White MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Alexander White can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Alexander White would suggest The Crooked Billet to the group.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where Alice Lewis, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game tonight; Alice suggests The Crooked Billet, William prefers The Princess of Wales, and Jacob and Alexander agree with William.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor can suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game at, or he can go along with the group's current plan to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game at.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Alice Lewis: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.8
          Alexander White: 0.8
          Jacob Walker: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Crooked Billet.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!

          Answer: Jack Taylor can suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game at, or he can go along with the group's current plan to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Crooked Billet.
        FinalAction
      • Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game at.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Alice Lewis: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.8
          Alexander White: 0.8
          Jacob Walker: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Jack Taylor MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Jack Taylor can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Crooked Billet.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently at a market with friends and will be watching a soccer game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoy the atmosphere, and perhaps indulge in some coffee and pastries.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest his favorite pub, The Princess of Wales, as the best place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, sharing some drinks and conversation.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoy the atmosphere, and perhaps indulge in some coffee and pastries.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
      Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's picnicking in the park, watching football games at the pub, or browsing a bustling market. He values the company of his friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and wishes they were always present for these social gatherings.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that they all go to The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's picnicking in the park, watching football games at the pub, or browsing a bustling market. He values the company of his friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and wishes they were always present for these social gatherings.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
      Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at a bustling market where he is with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker loves the market's atmosphere, praising the pastries and music. William Jones suggests watching the Moldova versus Monaco game at The Princess of Wales pub that night.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Jack Taylor: 0.5
          Jacob Walker: 0.3
          Alice Lewis: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White would suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
      Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?

        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"

        • Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at a bustling market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are enjoying coffee, pastries, and live music. Jacob Walker loves the atmosphere of the market, while William Jones suggests watching the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Princess of Wales. Alexander White proposes The Crooked Billet as an alternative venue.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could join his friends at the market or suggest they all go to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Alexander White: 0.8
          Alice Lewis: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.8
          Jacob Walker: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion and watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
          Jacob Walker: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

Jacob Walker loves the atmosphere of the market, while William Jones suggests watching the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Princess of Wales. Alexander White proposes The Crooked Billet as an alternative venue.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?

Jacob Walker loves the atmosphere of the market, while William Jones suggests watching the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Princess of Wales. Alexander White proposes The Crooked Billet as an alternative venue.

          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Jack Taylor MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Jack Taylor can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Crooked Billet? It's a great place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Crooked Billet? It's a great place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales?
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, what more could you ask for?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I'm ready to head to The Princess of Wales when you are.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alice Lewis -- "Let's go to The Crooked Billet then!
      William Jones -- "Hey, what about The Princess of Wales? It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Princess of Wales! It's the best spot to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking The Crooked Billet might be a good spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, The Crooked Billet it is!
      Jacob Walker -- "This market is fantastic! The pastries smell divine, and the music is so lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "Hey, how about we check out The Crooked Billet for the game instead?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Crooked Billet? It's a great place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Crooked Billet? It's a great place to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Crooked Billet? It's a great place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at a bustling market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker loves the lively atmosphere of the market, while the group is debating where to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game tonight. William Jones suggests The Princess of Wales, while Alexander White prefers The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor also favors The Princess of Wales.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could suggest The Crooked Billet to the group again, emphasizing her preference and the enjoyment it would bring to watch the game there.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to the group again.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Alexander White: 0.9
          Jack Taylor: 0.7
          Jacob Walker: 0.6
          William Jones: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What action Alice Lewis should do now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would suggest The Crooked Billet to the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "How about we go to The Crooked Billet? It's a great place to watch the game.
