2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy having William Jones there to make it more social. He would be particularly happy if Alice Lewis joined them, as it would show she cares. Jack Taylor's presence is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind Jacob Walker being there, it's not essential for him to have a good time.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could contact his friends and suggest meeting at The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to contact Alice Lewis first, as her presence is most important to him.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Alice Lewis: 0.8
          Jacob Walker: 0.2
          Jack Taylor: 0.2
          William Jones: 0.6
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to contact his friends and suggest meeting at The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White would contact Alice Lewis first.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy having William Jones there to make it more social. He would be particularly happy if Alice Lewis joined them, as it would show she cares. Jack Taylor's presence is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind Jacob Walker being there, it's not essential for him to have a good time.

          Answer: Alexander White would contact Alice Lewis first.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor wants to go watch the game at a pub and would enjoy seeing William Jones there. He is neutral about the presence of Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Jack Taylor sees the game as a chance to bond with Jacob Walker.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could contact his friends and suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game together.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to contact his friends and suggest The Princess of Wales.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: William Jones: 0.7
          Jacob Walker: 0.8
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)
